abstract.text: Add, fetch, complete, remove, and sort location-based reminders in your app.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: With the Reminders app, users can create reminders with attachments, and alarms based on time and location. When Location Services is turned on, users receive location-based reminders when entering or leaving a specified geographic area or geofence. This sample demonstrates how to add, fetch, complete, remove, and sort location-based reminders.

The sample first requests and receives authorization from the user before the app attempts to access their reminder data. It provides a purpose string or usage description that describes how the app intends to use the user’s reminder data. It then adds the
key to the app’s
. The sample sets its value to a string that explains why the app needs access to reminder data. The system displays the string when prompting the user for authorization.
This
key is required for apps that access the user’s reminder data. Apps crash when the key is absent.

that manages all reminder-related tasks. An
object requires a significant amount of time to initialize and release. The user might add, remove, or update reminders while your app is running. Register for an

notification to be notified about changes to the Calendar database. When you receive this notification, refresh all your reminder data. It’s possible that your current data is stale or invalid. For more information on change notification, see
for details.

Creating location-based reminders doesn’t require location services.
The sample app uses location services to display the user’s current location on the map. As such, it includes and configures the

content.text: Check for the Existence of a Default List

inlineContent.text: Creating a reminder requires a list, which is a calendar for these items. Use
’s
to check whether the user has specified a default list for reminders. If
returns no value, prompt the user to create a list in the Reminders app or provide a mechanism that lets them create it from within the app. The app provides an
button that allows users to create a new list.
A location-based reminder is a reminder created with a geofence-enabled alarm. A geofence-enabled alarm has a structured location and proximity configured. The structured
location consists of a location object and radius. The
is defined in meters and uses the system’s default radius when its value is 0. When the user provides a value for
in a unit other than meters such as miles, convert this value before using it. The sample uses the following steps to create a location-based reminder.
First, it creates an
object using
, then it sets its
and
properties:

code: guard let calendar = store.defaultCalendarForNewReminders() else { throw LocationBasedRemindersError.missingDefaultRemindersList }

Finally, it saves the reminder to the user’s Calendar database:
The
method asynchronously fetches all reminders matching a given predicate. When successful,
returns an array that contains both time-based and location-based reminders.

inlineContent.text: To retrieve location-based reminders, the sample parses this array for reminders defined with an existing alarm that has a
and

code: /// Indicates whether a reminder is a location-based one.
guard let alarms = self.alarms else { return false }

inlineContent.text: Retrieving reminders from the Calendar database returns reminders sorted by creation date. To sort an array of
objects by title, or any other property, the sample
implements
on the array with a predicate that uses the property.

code: /// - Returns: An array of reminders sorted by title in an ascending order.
return self.sorted(by: { (first: EKReminder, second: EKReminder) in

abstract.text: Create, view, and edit calendar and reminder events.
A class that represents an event in a calendar.
An object that accesses a person’s calendar events and reminders and supports the scheduling of new events.
Determines the authorization status for the given entity type.
A class that represents a reminder in a calendar.
Create and modify events and reminders in a person’s database.
Fetch events and reminders from the Calendar database.
Register for notifications about changes and keep your app up to date.
